Package it.polimi.ingsw.msgUtilities.server

Class AnswerMsgWriter

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.msgUtilities.server.AnswerMsgWriter
public class AnswerMsgWriter
extends java.lang.Object
This class contains all the methods useful to write an XML schema message which represents a response to a client from the server.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    AnswerMsgWriter()
    This constructor initializes the document with the standard XML schema content in toSendAnswer file (content in resources folder).

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    org.w3c.dom.Document buildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int x, int y, int level)
    This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a build request.
    org.w3c.dom.Document choseGodAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, int godId)
    This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a choseGods request.
    org.w3c.dom.Document choseStartingPlayerAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String playerChosen)
    This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a choseStartingPlayer request.

    This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a createGods request.
    org.w3c.dom.Document endOfTurnRemoveAndBuildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int level)
    This method is triggered when the player in turn's god is Medusa.

    This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a login request.

    This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a move request.

    This method provides to write the next operation that user has to do during his turn.

    This method provides to format a rejected answer associated with a request to set worker on board.

  • Constructor Details

    • AnswerMsgWriter

      public AnswerMsgWriter()
      This constructor initializes the document with the standard XML schema content in toSendAnswer file (content in resources folder).

  • Method Details

    • setStandardAnswerValues

      public org.w3c.dom.Document setStandardAnswerValues​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String mod, java.lang.String out)
      This method writes under the three standard tags (both accepted and rejected responses)
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      mod - is the request mode (login, startGame...)
      out - is the outcome of the response
      Returns:
      the document updated

    • rejectedAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document rejectedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String mod, java.util.List<Error> errors)
      This method provides to format a rejected answer. It set the standard values and provides to report the error list.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      mod - is the request mode (login, startGame...)
      errors - is the error list to report to the client
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • rejectedSetWorkerOnBoardAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document rejectedSetWorkerOnBoardAnswer​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String mod, java.util.List<Error> errors, java.lang.String gender)
      This method provides to format a rejected answer associated with a request to set worker on board. It sets the standard values and provides to report the error list.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      mod - is the request mode (login, startGame...)
      errors - is the error list to report to the client
      gender - is the worker user request to place on board gender
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • loginAcceptedAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document loginAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, Color c, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​Color> users)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a login request. It sets the standard values and provides to report color received and users already present in the game.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      c - is the color assigned to the user
      users - is the user list to report to the client
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • startGameAcceptedAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document startGameAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a startGame request. It only sets standard values.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request.
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • createGodsAcceptedAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document createGodsAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> ids)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a createGods request. It sets standard values and provides to report the god's id list generated.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      ids - is the god's id list
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • choseGodAcceptedAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document choseGodAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, int godId)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a choseGods request. It sets standard values and provides to report the god chosen id.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      godId - is the chosen god id
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • choseStartingPlayerAcceptedAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document choseStartingPlayerAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String playerChosen)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a choseStartingPlayer request. It sets standard values and provides to report the player chosen to start the match.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      playerChosen - is the player chosen to start the match
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • setupOnBoardAcceptedAnswer

      public org.w3c.dom.Document setupOnBoardAcceptedAnswer​(java.lang.String user, java.lang.String workerGender, int x, int y)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a setupOnBoard request. It sets standard values and provides to report the worker gender and the coordinates where user placed his worker.
      Parameters:
      user - is the user who made the request
      workerGender - is the worker user request to place on board gender
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed his worker
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed his worker
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • moveUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document moveUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int x, int y)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a move request. It sets only the updates after this move.
      Parameters:
      index - is the progressive number of the update that move generated
      startX - is the x coordinate where worker was before he moves
      startY - is the y coordinate where worker was before he moves
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed his worker
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed his worker
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • buildUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document buildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int x, int y, int level)
      This method provides to format an accepted answer associated with a build request. It sets only the updates after this built.
      Parameters:
      index - is the progressive number of the update that move generated
      startX - is the x coordinate where worker is when he builds
      startY - is the y coordinate where worker is when he builds
      x - is the x coordinate where user placed a new block
      y - is the y coordinate where user placed a new block
      level - is the level of the new block
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • nextStepTurnIndication

      public org.w3c.dom.Document nextStepTurnIndication​(java.lang.String nextStep)
      This method provides to write the next operation that user has to do during his turn.
      Parameters:
      nextStep - is the next operation (move, build, move/build, end, build/end)
      Returns:
      the updated document

    • endOfTurnRemoveAndBuildUpdate

      public org.w3c.dom.Document endOfTurnRemoveAndBuildUpdate​(int index, int startX, int startY, int level)
      This method is triggered when the player in turn's god is Medusa. This method provides to write updates after he finished his turn (if workers on board have been removed)
      Parameters:
      index - is the progressive number of the update that Medusa's power generated
      startX - is the x position where worker removed was
      startY - is the y position where worker removed was
      level - is the new block built instead of the worker removed
      Returns:
      the updated document
